channel.title: Stuff.co.nz - Stuff
channel.description: Top Stories from Stuff.co.nz. New Zealand, world, sport, business & entertainment news on Stuff.co.nz.

item.title: Covid-19 live: Auckland to move to alert level 3, rest of country stays in level 2
item.description: The city will move down alert level at 11.59pm on Tuesday for at least two weeks, while the rest of NZ stays in level 2, and a part of Waikato with three recent cases will have a "bespoke" set of temporary rules.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Covid-19: The dos and do nots at alert level 3
item.description: It has been more than a year since those outside Auckland have been at alert level 3. Here's a reminder of what you can and can't do.
item.dc:creator: MARIN&EACUTE; LOURENS

item.title: Covid-19: Where exactly are Waikato's new coronavirus hotspots?
item.description: The new Covid sites sit just south of Auckland's border with Waikato.
item.dc:creator: AARON LEAMAN

item.title: Covid-19: Eliminating Delta from community hard but still feasible, experts say
item.description: Giving up on "stamp it out" strategy would see Covid-19 outbreak reach levels Victoria and New South Wales In Australia are seeing, experts say.
item.dc:creator: DANIELLE CLENT

item.title: Controversial recycling contract back on table for Invercargill City Council
item.description: The Invercargill City Council's contract to sort the city's kerbside recycling ends on December 31 but Southland disAbility Enterprises is the frontrunner to retain the job.
item.dc:creator: LOGAN SAVORY

item.title: Covid-19: 'Level 4 anxiety' as Waikato residents line up to be tested
item.description: They're still in level 2 but nervousness has spread through residents of Mangatangi and Kaiaua after news of cases in their midst.
item.dc:creator: JO LINES-MACKENZIE

item.title: Truck rolls on Nelson roundabout
item.description: Police are attending the scene at the Quarantine Rd-Whakatu roundabout.
item.dc:creator: AMY RIDOUT

item.title: Man who dragged his partner up and down the stairs was under stress, court hears
item.description: When his partner told him she wanted to leave, David MacDonald assaulted her.
item.dc:creator: AMY RIDOUT

item.title: Driver, 21, of vehicle that crashed in New Plymouth has died in hospital
item.description: The driver of a vehicle that crashed in New Plymouth earlier this month has died in hospital.
item.dc:creator: TARA SHASKEY

item.title: UFC 266: Kiwi fighter Dan Hooker gets dramatic eleventh-hour US visa, fights Saturday in Las Vegas
item.description: Last-ditch US visa approval means Kiwi UFC star will be fighting in the octagon just 48 hours after arriving in Las Vegas.
item.dc:creator: MAT KERMEEN

item.title: A day of celebration for Jimmy McGuinness as tree removed
item.description: A ‘’matchstick’’ which grew to a large tree, and a major headache for a Timaru man, has been removed from outside his property.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS TOBIN

item.title: Covid-19: One of the lucky ones - Napier man secures one of 3000 MIQ spots for his wife
item.description: First he had a spot for his wife, then he didn't, then he did again.
item.dc:creator: MARTY SHARPE

item.title: Covid-19 NZ: Auckland will move to alert level 3 tomorrow night for at least two weeks
item.description: Jacinda Ardern says "long hard tail" of Delta has been tough but level 3 will be able to contain it.
item.dc:creator: HENRY COOKE

item.title: Winched to safety: how a locator beacon saved John Tame's life
item.description: Lost in the bush and hypothermic, John Tame hallucinated an igloo and a visitor centre. Injured after a fall, he needed help fast.
item.dc:creator: KATIE TOWNSHEND

item.title: Sexual health expert calls for accelerated effort to eliminate syphilis and HIV
item.description: Sexual health expert says it's vital for NZ to tackle the potentially deadly conditions, especially among gay and bisexual men.
item.dc:creator: STEPHEN FORBES LOCAL DEMOCRACY REPORTER

item.title: Ariki throw weight behind push for Māori to get vaccinated, to protect their whakapapa
item.description: “Now is the time when we must consider how we protect ourselves, our whānau, our whakapapa and everything about te iwi Māori."
item.dc:creator: MAXINE JACOBS

item.title: Manawatū pioneer in education for young Māori dies
item.description: Joan Kennett worked in early childhood centres for more than 50 years.
item.dc:creator: GEORGE HEAGNEY

item.title: Covid-19 vaccine: Fewer than 27k doses given on Sunday amid push to get Akl jabbed
item.description: Everything you need to know about New Zealand's Covid-19 vaccine programme, including details on when you can expect your jab.
item.dc:creator: HANNAH MARTIN

item.title: Business boss facing dozens of sex charges sees new allegations laid against him
item.description: The man, a chief executive of a Christchurch-based company, faces more than 50 charges, including filming himself sexually violating a child.
item.dc:creator: JODY O'CALLAGHAN

item.title: Veteran Southland firefighters remember the days of using water buckets
item.description: Two veteran firefighters, with a combined service of more 100 years in northern Southland, remember when they started with the bucket brigade in the 1960s.
item.dc:creator: JAMIE SEARLE
